Package com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl

Class FoldingModelImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.InlayModel.SimpleAdapter
      • com.intellij.openapi.editor.impl.FoldingModelImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dumpable, DocumentListener, FoldingModelEx, PrioritizedDocumentListener, FoldingModel, InlayModel.Listener, ModificationTracker, java.util.EventListener

    public class FoldingModelImpl
extends InlayModel.SimpleAdapter
implements FoldingModelEx, PrioritizedDocumentListener, Dumpable, ModificationTracker

      • isOffsetCollapsed

        public boolean isOffsetCollapsed(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModel
        Checks if the specified offset in the document belongs to a folded region. The region must contain given offset or be located right after given offset, i.e. the following condition must hold: foldStartOffset <= offset < foldEndOffset.
        This method can return incorrect data if it's invoked in the context of FoldingModel.runBatchFoldingOperation(Runnable) invocation.
        Specified by:
        isOffsetCollapsed in interface FoldingModel
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset to check.
        Returns:
        true if the offset belongs to a folded region, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        FoldingModel.getCollapsedRegionAtOffset(int)

      • setFoldingEnabled

        public void setFoldingEnabled(boolean isEnabled)
        Specified by:
        setFoldingEnabled in interface FoldingModelEx

      • addFoldRegion

        public FoldRegion addFoldRegion(int startOffset,
                                int endOffset,
                                java.lang.String placeholderText)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModel
        Adds a fold region for the specified range of the document. This method must be called from the Runnable passed to FoldingModel.runBatchFoldingOperation(Runnable). The region is initially not folded.
        Specified by:
        addFoldRegion in interface FoldingModel
        Parameters:
        startOffset - the start offset of the region to fold.
        endOffset - the end offset of the region to fold.
        placeholderText - the text to display instead of the region contents when the region is folded.
        Returns:
        the fold region, or null if folding is currently disabled or corresponding region cannot be added (e.g. if it intersects with another existing region)

      • runBatchFoldingOperation

        public void runBatchFoldingOperation(java.lang.Runnable operation,
                                     boolean allowMovingCaret,
                                     boolean keepRelativeCaretPosition)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModel
        Performs folding model changes (creation/deletion/expanding/collapsing of fold regions).
        Specified by:
        runBatchFoldingOperation in interface FoldingModel
        allowMovingCaret - If false, requests to collapse a region containing caret won't be processed. If true - corresponding operation will be performed with caret automatically moved to the region's start offset (original caret position is remembered and is restored on region expansion).
        keepRelativeCaretPosition - If true, editor scrolling position will be adjusted after the operation, so that vertical caret position will remain unchanged (if caret is not visible at operation start, top left corner of editor will be used as an anchor instead). If false, no scrolling adjustment will be done.

      • runBatchFoldingOperation

        public void runBatchFoldingOperation(java.lang.Runnable operation,
                                     boolean moveCaret)
        Specified by:
        runBatchFoldingOperation in interface FoldingModel

      • getAllFoldRegions

        public FoldRegion [] getAllFoldRegions()
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModel
        Gets the list of all fold regions in the specified editor. Returned array is sorted according to RangeMarker.BY_START_OFFSET comparator, i.e. first by start offset, then by end offset.
        Specified by:
        getAllFoldRegions in interface FoldingModel
        Returns:
        the array of fold regions, or an empty array if folding is currently disabled.

      • getCollapsedRegionAtOffset

        public FoldRegion getCollapsedRegionAtOffset(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModel
        Returns collapsed folded region at a given offset or null if there's no such region. Returned region will satisfy the following condition: region.getStartOffset() <= offset < region.getEndOffset()
        This method can return incorrect data if it's invoked in the context of FoldingModel.runBatchFoldingOperation(Runnable) invocation.
        Specified by:
        getCollapsedRegionAtOffset in interface FoldingModel
        See Also:
        FoldingModel.isOffsetCollapsed(int)

      • getFoldRegion

        public FoldRegion getFoldRegion(int startOffset,
                                int endOffset)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModel
        Returns fold region with given boundaries, if it exists, or null otherwise.
        Specified by:
        getFoldRegion in interface FoldingModel

        public int getLastCollapsedRegionBefore(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: FoldingModelEx
        Returns an index in an array returned by FoldingModelEx.fetchTopLevel() method, for the last folding region lying entirely before given offset (region can touch given offset at its right edge).

      • createFoldRegion

        public FoldRegion createFoldRegion(int startOffset,
                                   int endOffset,
                                   java.lang.String placeholder,
                                   FoldingGroup group,
                                   boolean neverExpands)
        Specified by:
        createFoldRegion in interface FoldingModelEx
        neverExpands - If true, the created region is created in the collapsed state, and cannot be expanded (FoldRegion.setExpanded(boolean) does nothing for it). No marker will be displayed in gutter for such a region. 'Never-expanding' fold region cannot be part of a FoldingGroup.
